plugin._field_explanation: Adds accelerations into unit's movement (by simulating movement stick change) and/or view angle (by simulating camera stick change)

At SI spawn time the SI's angle is determined by adding the result of 'response type' & 'mapping type' to a random angle in given angle range. Each tick, this acceleration angle is multiplied by the final scaler resulting from logic below. That scaled impulse is then applied as stick input.

Starting scaler value comes from damage multiplier or is set to 1.0 if SI not directly related to damage. That is then scaled by the following: * area control falloff * function output y: func(SI_elapsed_time/duration) --> y) * 1 / zoom magnification * tick_delta_secs / tick_length result of this is final scaler value
0 - pitch up, +/-180 - pitch down -90 - yaw left, +90 - yaw right

item.Name: ignore base scaler#Always start with 1.0 instead of any value from damage multiplier value
ignore area control falloff#Skip this scaler
ignore elapsed time function scaler#Skip this scaler

_field_real.name: inverse duration:seconds#if >0.f, accumulated inpulse will be 'undone' over the give time span
inverse random length:percent#15.0 would randomly adjust length of accumulated impulse +/-15%

_field_real_bounds.name: inverse random angle:degrees#apply random adjustment to direction of accumulated impulse

_field_real.name: linear zoom penalty#linear multiplier of zoom that increases effect; computed for no change at zoom 1
square root zoom penalty#multiplier to increase effect proportional to square root of zoom; computed for no change at zoom 1
